briefTitle: Short Duration Versus Standard Response-Guided Therapy With Boceprevir Combined With PegIntron and Ribavirin in Previously Untreated Non-Cirrhotic Asian Participants With Chronic HCV Genotype 1 (MK-3034-107)
officialTitle: A Phase 3 Clinical Trial to Study Short Duration Versus Standard Response-Guided Therapy With MK-3034 (SCH 503034)/Boceprevir Combined With PegIntron and Ribavirin in Previously Untreated Non-Cirrhotic Subjects With Chronic HCV Genotype 1 in Asia
summary: The purpose of this study is to estimate the difference in the efficacy between a 16-week treatment regimen of boceprevir (BOC) in combination with peg-intron alpha 2b (P) plus ribavirin (R) (BOC + PR) and a 28-week treatment regimen of BOC + PR in previously untreated participants with chronic hepatitis C (CHC) genotype 1 in Asia who achieve undetectable hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA).

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Undetectable HCV RNA Who Achieve Sustained Viral Response at Follow-up Week 12 (SVR12) [16-Week Arm vs. 28-Week Arm]
